title: Rahul will lead anti-SIR stir in Bengal if ECI repeats Bihar mistakes: Congress leader Prasenjit Bose
content: Mr. Bose said he expected a political realignment of opposition parties against the BJP if and when the special intensive revision of rolls happens in West Bengal

title: Former Minister, 400 YSRCP activists booked for organising ‘Chalo Medical Colleges’ protest
content: “The party activists violated police orders, behaved rudely with the officers and disrupted traffic,” say police

title: Ex-Odisha MLA George Tirkey dies at 67
content: A popular tribal leader, Tirkey was elected twice on a JMM ticket, and once each as an Independent candidate and a nominee of Samata Kranti Dal, founded by him

title: Why are deaths occurring despite rabies vaccine? Doctors stress strict adherence to prevention and treatment steps
content: Rabies is fatal once symptoms appear, but fully preventable if the right steps are taken immediately and correctly, say experts; lack of awareness and cold chain supply issues are some areas that need enhanced focus, they say

title: Faded zebra crossings, no signals endanger pedestrians at 16 major junctions in Kochi
content: Earlier this month, Traffic West police wrote to Public Works department seeking immediate interventions at these junctions

title: Overnight showers bring pleasant weather to Chennai; more rain likely in north Tamil Nadu
content: Widespread thunderstorm activity since Friday (September 19) night kept Saturday’s maximum temperature at 29 degree Celsius in Chennai at 11 a.m.

title: Assam Govt to conduct inquiry into singer Zubeen Garg’s death, says CM Himanta; autopsy completed in Singapore
content: The popular singer died while "swimming in the sea without a life jacket", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Friday. His mortal remains will be kept in the Sarusajai Stadium for the people to pay their last respects

title: Kurnool SC/ST court convicts five in two cases of abusing woman
content: According to Superintendent of Police Vikrant Patil, the complainant Govindamma resides in Weaker Section colony under the IV Town police limits of Kurnool city

title: Navi Mumbai road rage case: Driver of former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar’s father arrested
content: According to the police, the incident occurred on September 13 on the Mulund-Airoli Road in Navi Mumbai after a concrete mixer truck driven by Prahlad Kumar (22) brushed against a Land Cruiser car

title: Uma Thomas stadium fall: Kerala Police chargesheet event organisers, stage contractor
content: Chargesheet filed before Ernakulam Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-IX on August 27, CM Pinarayi Vijayan tells Assembly in reply to a question by Thrikkakara MLA Uma Thomas recently

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin commends launch of underwater archaeological survey off Poompuhar coast
content: “We proclaimed Keeladi as the cradle of our civilisation. We showed the world the antiquity of iron. Next, we shall bring forth the glory of Poompuhar,” CM Stalin said

title: Rail blockade by Kurmis underway in Jharkhand, train services partially affected
content: In view of the stir, the Ranchi administration imposed prohibitory orders under Section 163 of BNSS in a 300-meter radius of various stations falling in the district.

title: Non-contact warfare new normal, India must stay ahead of curve: Lt Gen Adosh Kumar
content: Modern conflicts increasingly rely on remote power such as surveillance capabilities and cyber operations, and the Indian Army must be ready to dominate in these areas, said Lt Gen Adosh Kumar

title: Nearly ₹2 lakh crore will be in people's hand due to GST reforms: FM Sitharaman
content: The Finance Ministry does not receive the ₹2 lakh crore as taxes from the public, but it goes back into the economy aiding domestic consumption,” FM Nirmala Sitharaman said

title: Public convention in Siuri protests against the Deocha Pachami mining project of the West Bengal government
content: Local residents and activists allege illegal land acquisition and fear displacement as the coal mining project progresses

title: Rains LIVE: Himachal’s Mcleodganj cut off, landslide near prominent school in Shimla
content: A total of 425 roads, including three national Highways, namely NH 3 (Attari-Leh road), NH-5 (Old Hindustan-Tibet Road) and the NH-503A (Amritsar-Bhota road), were closed in Himachal

title: Amendments to caste list likely to address concerns
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is learnt to have told the Commission on September 19, to address the concerns on inclusion of ‘new castes’, which has turned controversial

title: Exercise 'strictest vigilance': MEA to Indians seeking employment in Iran
content: The MEA said there have been a number of recent cases of Indian citizens being lured to travel to Iran on false promises of employment or with assurances that they would be sent further to third countries for jobs

title: UAE looking to invest in India’s high-tech areas, says Goyal
content: He also said that the proposed Bharat Mart project will give small businesses the opportunity to become large exporters

title: Allahabad High Court asks U.P. government to regulate caste glorification, remove caste references from FIRs, public records
content: The High Court came down heavily on the police and said that the investigative impartiality and enforcement neutrality must be consciously cultivated, especially in a society where caste is pervasive

title: Rajasthan Cabinet approves first sports university, simplifies family pension rules
content: Rajasthan Cabinet approves sports university, pension rules, and NRI fee structure changes to enhance education and support systems

title: PM Modi to dedicate Dhordo as India’s newest solar village
content: The system is projected to generate 2.95 lakh units of electricity annually, directly translating into significant economic relief for residents.

title: Bombay High Court refuses to interfere in ward formation, says elections cannot be derailed
content: The Aurangabad Bench of the Bombay High Court dismisses petitions challenging Zilla Parishad elections, citing Constitutional bar on interference and urgency of polls

title: CBI arrests five more in CGPSC scam case
content: CBI arrests five, including a retired IAS officer and his son, in the Chhattisgarh CGPSC exam irregularities case

title: Breaking barriers: First Chuktia Bhunjia girl from Odisha clears PhD
content: Jaiminee Jhankar, a Chuktia Bhunjia tribe girl, defies tradition to earn a doctoral degree in Odisha, highlighting herbal medicine toxicity

title: Chennai’s V. Mohan gets first-ever EASD Diabetes Global Impact Prize
content: Dr. Mohan’s contributions have had a huge impact on diabetes healthcare, research, charity, education, training, awareness and policy both in India and globally

title: MSC Elsa 3 shipwreck off Kerala coast caused significant ecological disruption in south-eastern Arabian Sea, finds study
content: The shipwreck impacted water quality, plankton, benthos, fish eggs and larvae, and higher marine life, finds investigation by Centre for Marine Living Resources and Ecology

title: Army soldier injured as encounter breaks out in J&K’s Udhampur
content: A Police spokesman said the terrorists were spotted in the Seoj Dhar area. The police said its special operations group also joined the Army on the ground

title: Supreme Court issues notice to CPI(M) in dispute over land hosting its Kerala headquarters
content: The petitioner claims she purchased land from a family whose properties were attached due to unpaid loans and says the execution proceedings leading to the sale and delivery of the land violated explicit terms and mandate of a court decree

title: CPI’s 25th congress to be held in Chandigarh from September 21-25
content: The party will be mulling on whether to continue with D. Raja as general secretary or to pick a new face

title: Tamil Nadu company says it has developed water-to-hydrogen technology
content: HONC Gas Pvt. Ltd. says the technology converts purified water into hydrogen gas through a proprietary multi-stage electrolysis and gas-blending process. The company is awaiting government approval to bring the technology to market

title: Concerns about Bihar SIR are nothing but fake narrative: Ajit Pawar
content: Communities in Maharashtra are worried about reservation, but we won’t take from one to give to another, he says

title: India, U.S. to intensify efforts for a trade deal, says MEA
content: “We have seen U.S. statement regarding revocation of sanctions waiver for Chabahar port; we are presently examining its implications for India,” says MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

title: Rajnath Singh to inaugurate India’s first overseas Defence factory in Morocco
content: The Tata Advanced Systems Ltd (TASL) plant has been established in Casablanca in partnership with Morocco’s Royal Armed Forces

title: Karnataka CEO will continue to assist probe into Aland case: ECI
content: Poll panel clarifies that Karnataka CEO’s office had found the 5,994 applications for voter deletion to be incorrect and thus rejected them, and also flagged them for investigation

title: If govt. can hold dialogue with Pakistan, then why not our own people, asks Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: Mr. Reddy urged the Centre to hold a dialogue with those Maoists who want to join the mainstream; since 2024, more than 400 persons allegedly involved in Maoism have been killed in Chhattisgarh by security forces

title: Stalin inaugurates ₹574-crore data centre of Equinix at Siruseri SIPCOT
content: The Chennai data centre will provide a total site capacity of 4,250 cabinets when fully built. The first phase provides 800 cabinets, says Manoj Paul, Managing Director of Equinix India

title: Sikh leaders submit report to PM on safekeeping of Jore Sahib
content: The PM wrote on X that he is very happy with the meeting in which he was given recommendations with regard to the safekeeping and display of the ‘immensely sacred and invaluable holy Jore Sahib’

title: No vendetta politics in tackling industrial pollution, says Pawan Kalyan
content: Govt. wants to adopt a cooperative approach with industries to work out solutions and not scare them away, announces Deputy Chief Minister

title: Plea in Supreme Court questions AAIB report, seeks independent probe into Air India crash in Ahmedabad
content: The petition filed by a non-profit claims that the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau’s preliminary report ‘contains selective disclosures’ that create a ‘misleading impression’ about what led to the aviation accident

title: AICC national secretary Mayura Jayakumar moves Madras High Court to quash criminal intimidation case
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar orders notices, returnable by October 10, to the Peelamedu police in Coimbatore and the complainant Kovai Selvan

title: One more succumbs to suspected Amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: The victim was identified as Raheem, a native of Chavakkad in Thrissur district, who was admitted to the Kozhikode MCH

title: Childhood cancers account for over 2% of new cases in Karnataka annually
content: An analysis of childhood cancer patterns in Bengaluru by doctors at Kidwai shows that leukaemia remains the leading one, contributing to over 40% of cases in boys and more than one-third in girls.

title: Police Training School to be named after ‘Veeramangai’ Velu Nachiyar: Stalin
content: The Chief Minister unveils the statue of the freedom fighter, constructed at a cost of ₹50 lakh, at Gandhi Mandapam in Chennai. He points out that the government’s tableau for the Republic Day Parade in 2023 featured her statue

title: Karnataka has just 8.9% women in police force, far behind Bihar, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu: NLSIU study
content: This is well below the national average of 12.73%, says the study, adding that despite carrying a heavy share of routine police work, women are often excluded from meaningful responsibilities

title: After many challenges, baby Nova turns one
content: On Friday (September 19, 2025), as Nova celebrated his first birthday, Lourdes Hospital in Kochi erupted in joy as it was here that Nova was born, at just 23-week gestation

title: Assembly passes Bills increasing daily working hours for workmen, reducing green tax on HCVs
content: Three more Bills, including one allowing night time employment of women with certain safety and security precautions, also passed

title: Coast Guard ship Adamya commissioned at Paradip Port
content: The 51-metre long fast patrol vessel has been designed and built by Goa Shipyard Limited with over 60% indigenous content, the Coast Guard says; it is the first in a series of eight such vessels

title: KTR questions CM’s silence on Almatti dam height increase plans of Karnataka
content: Says it would spell a doom for South Telangana, makes PRLIS useless by giving up rights over Krishna water to Karnataka

title: As India and Canada reset ties, NSAs, diplomats meet in Delhi, discuss Khalistani threat and security cooperation
content: The discussions mark first such delegation level talks since the 2023 rupture over the Nijjar killing; focus on information sharing, counter-terrorism coperation, and extradition of wanted Khalistanis

title: ‘Deepika Student Scholarship’ to provides ₹30,000 per year to 37,000 girl students
content: The programme of the Department of Higher Education, in collaboration with the Azim Premji Foundation, aims to support the higher education of girl students

title: Karnataka and Telangana projects on the Krishna will harm A.P.’s interests, says MLA Somireddy
content: The Karnataka Cabinet has resolved to increase the height of Almatti dam to 524 feet to draw 130 tmcft of water, while the Telangana government has prepared DPRs for 16 projects to utilise 150 tmcft, he tells the Legislative Assembly

title: Watch: Heavy rains trigger landslides, hundreds stranded in Uttarakhand and Himachal
content: Relentless rain in Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh has caused massive landslides and road blockages, leaving hundreds of tourists and locals stranded. Chamoli saw over 40 homes destroyed, two deaths, and six people missing as rescue teams struggle to reach affected villages.

title: Hyderabad consumers skeptical of GST rate cut benefits, finds survey
content: Only 10% of Hyderabad consumers saw MRPs drop after last GST cut, 84% say brands must ensure benefits are passed on

title: Thomas' record triple-double puts Mercury in semis
content: Alyssa Thomas had the first 20-point triple-double in WNBA postseason history, and the Mercury advanced to the semifinals by eliminating the defending champion Liberty 79-73 in Game 3 on Friday night.

title: Kershaw soaks in curtain call in possible L.A. finale
content: Clayton Kershaw treated Dodgers fans to a strikeout on his final pitch Friday night and left the field to raucous cheers in his last regular-season start at Dodger Stadium.

title: Tulsa tops OSU in Stillwater for 1st time since '51
content: Baylor Hayes threw for 219 yards and a touchdown to help Tulsa defeat Oklahoma State in Stillwater on Friday night for the first time since Nov. 3, 1951.

title: 49ers to start Jones at QB in place of ailing Purdy
content: Barring a significant last-minute change, the San Francisco 49ers will start Mac Jones at quarterback for a second consecutive week Sunday against the Arizona Cardinals.

title: Royals rock Scherzer for 7 runs, crush Jays 20-1
content: Kansas City sent 10 batters to the plate in its seven-run first inning and the Royals beat the Toronto Blue Jays 20-1 on Friday night.

title: Ravens' Henry: Keep calling Hopkins 'washed'
content: Ravens RB Derrick Henry has heard the naysayers, and he's daring opponents to continue calling veteran receiver DeAndre Hopkins "washed."

title: Garrett, Parsons among 'best in this generation'
content: Browns edge rusher Myles Garrett, who faces off with pass rusher Micah Parsons and the Packers on Sunday in Cleveland, says he and Parsons are "two of the very best in this generation."

title: Rocked in minors, Senga feels unready to return
content: Mets right-hander Kodai Senga's return hit a snag after he told club officials Friday that he is not ready to pitch at the major league level after a rocky Triple-A outing the day before.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football: Week 3 last-minute pickups
content: Do injuries have you seeking a late-week pickup? Need a defense to stream? These options have favorable setups.

title: WWE Wrestlepalooza on ESPN: Cena-Lesnar to kick off the show
content: We break down the major Wrestlepalooza storylines, including John Cena vs. Brock Lesnar and the return of AJ Lee. Coverage starts at 5 p.m. ET Saturday in the ESPN App.

title: Clayton Kershaw's final act: Why even his opponents are collecting souvenirs
content: The future Hall of Famer makes his final regular-season start at Dodger Stadium tonight -- and it'll be special beyond the home clubhouse.

title: First look at the trade deadline: Candidates to move, plus teams that could be active
content: The NFL trade deadline isn't until Nov. 4, but we're looking ahead. Could Tyreek Hill or Kirk Cousins be moved?

title: The sneaky Big Ten game, the hyped-but-struggling QBs and more in Week 4
content: An unusual Big Ten showdown, a fun Big 12 headliner and a bunch of QBs looking to get right on tap this weekend.

content: The semifinals open Sunday. How do Indiana-Las Vegas and Phoenix-Minnesota match up? Who are the favorites?

content: After a historic summer on the court and massive changes off it, Luka Doncic has sent a message to the NBA. And his new team responded in kind.

content: Discussing the Browning-Chase connection and what to believe (and not believe) from early-season action.

title: A'ja Wilson vs. Napheesa Collier: The moments that reshaped the WNBA MVP race
content: What appeared to be a foregone conclusion in July turned into a hotly contested WNBA MVP race. What changed?

title: A deep dive into the mysterious Platypus Trophy of the Oregon-Oregon State rivalry
content: The story behind one of college football's most unusual trophies, which is an image of a most unusual animal.

title: Will Raleigh finish strong? Can Astros score without Alvarez? 5 things that will decide the AL West race
content: The Mariners and Astros are about to face off with the division title and playoff seeding on the line. Here's what will determine the race.

title: Thompson, Bedard, Keller, others using 4 Nations snubs as Olympic motivation
content: NHL players will participate in the Games for the first time since 2014, with rosters revealed in January.

title: Dalvin Cook meets Caleb Williams? How Tyriq Withers brought Cameron Cade to life
content: Tyriq Withers pulled from his own experience as a walk-on at FSU and working with quarterback guru Jordan Palmer to cultivate his character in the Jordan Peele-produced horror film.

title: What to know ahead of the Azerbaijan Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 ventures to Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan for round 17 of the 2025 season. Here's everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: 🏀 Inside Kawhi Leonard's tumultuous time in L.A.
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: 🔟 Barnwell ranks every winless NFL team
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: 💰 Could a salary cap really come to baseball?
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: 🏈 Why doesn't NFL every team use tush push?
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: ⚾ Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw to retire after season
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: 🎤 Johnson: Not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Al Nassr eyeing move for Casemiro
content: Al Nassr are reportedly looking to sign Manchester United midfielder Casemiro. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: UWCL draw reaction: Good for Chelsea, Barcelona; bad for Man United; must-see games
content: The Women's Champions League is back! So let's unpack all the must-see games, winners and losers, and talking points from Friday's draw for the 2025-26 league phase.

title: Why the champs and four other teams control the future of the NBA draft
content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: 'Faced racial hatred, food was poisoned’: Last post of Indian shot dead in US; he was jobless for a year
content: Mohammed Nizamuddin, a software engineer from Telangana, was fatally shot by Santa Clara police. Prior to his death, he posted on LinkedIn alleging racial discrimination, workplace harassment, and wage fraud at his former company. Nizamuddin claimed he faced a hostile environment, his food was poisoned, and he was being evicted for fighting injustice.

title: Trump hikes H-1B visa fee to $100,000! How will Indian IT companies?
content: The Trump administration significantly increased H-1B visa fees, requiring a $100,000 payment per application, effective September 21, 2025. This aims to curb program misuse and prioritize higher-paid specialists, potentially impacting Indian IT professionals. Major tech companies like Amazon and TCS, who are the top recipients of H-1B visas, will be significantly affected by this change.

title: 'Soft corner for Pakistan': BJP slams Congress after Pitroda remark, Afridi praise for Rahul
content: BJP's Amit Malviya has strongly criticized Congress, citing Shahid Afridi's praise for Rahul Gandhi and Sam Pitroda's remarks about feeling at home in Pakistan. Malviya accused Congress of prioritizing appeasement over national interest and having a soft corner for Pakistan. He further linked these statements to the historical context of Partition, accusing the party of a continued pattern.

title: ‘Complete failure’: Baby survives 4th-floor fall; dies after being stuck in traffic
content: A 16-month-old boy died in traffic on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad National Highway after falling from a Nalasopara balcony. The family was transporting him to a Mumbai hospital for treatment of serious injuries. This incident follows a similar tragedy where a woman died due to traffic delays after a tree fall, raising concerns about traffic management on the highway.

title: Andhra Pradesh: Drunk man bites off snake’s head after being bitten; sleeps beside it
content: In a shocking incident near Chiyyavaram village, an intoxicated man named Venkatesh retaliated after being bitten by a venomous krait. Enraged, he bit off the snake's head, killing it. Now battling for his life in a government hospital, Venkatesh's condition is critical as the venom spreads, leaving the local community in disbelief.

title: H1-B visa fees hike to $100K: Microsoft warns employees; asks to return immediately
content: Microsoft urged its H-1B and H-4 visa employees to return to the US before the September 21 deadline due to a new $100,000 annual fee per H-1B worker. The company also advised those already in the US to remain there.

title: Hunt on for Puja Khedkar’s family: Navi Mumbai police arrest driver; mother, dad still absconding
content: Navi Mumbai police have arrested Praful Salunkhe, the driver of former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar's father, in connection with the abduction of a truck driver following a road rage incident. The victim, Prahlad Kumar, was rescued from the Khedkar family bungalow in Pune, where Puja's mother allegedly obstructed police.

title: 'Stop bringing people to take our jobs': Trump aide explains reason behind H1B fee hike
content: President Trump has implemented a $100,000 annual fee for companies sponsoring H-1B visa holders, a substantial increase intended to discourage the replacement of American workers with foreign labor. This policy shift aims to prioritize American graduates and limit H-1B visas to high-value roles, potentially reshaping skilled worker hiring, especially in the tech and IT sectors.

title: iPhone to AI era: Man who helped build Apple’s icon; now stealing staff for OpenAI
content: OpenAI is aggressively poaching Apple employees and partnering with its suppliers, aiming to launch consumer hardware by late 2026. Led by former Apple executive Tang Tan, the recruitment drive has attracted talent in design, manufacturing, and engineering. OpenAI plans a family of screen-free, pocket-sized AI devices, challenging Apple's dominance and creating tension between the two companies.

title: SBI heist: Robbers abandon part of bank loot in Maha; Rs 41L cash, 6.5 kg gold recovered
content: Karnataka police have recovered a portion of the valuables stolen from the State Bank of India's Chadchan branch. The robbers, who fled to Maharashtra, abandoned part of their loot after a confrontation with villagers in Hulajanti village. The recovered bag contained 6.5 kg of gold jewellery and Rs 41 lakh in cash, according to Vijayapura SP Laxman Nimbargi.

title: INDW vs AUSW: India to wear pink jerseys in breast cancer awareness initiative
content: In a historic move, the Indian women's cricket team will don pink jerseys for the final ODI against Australia in Delhi, raising breast cancer awareness. This marks the first instance of an Indian cricket team sporting pink for this cause.

title: Muslim man can have multiple wives only if he ensures justice to all: Kerala HC
content: Kerala High Court ruled that Muslim personal law permits multiple marriages only if the husband can ensure justice to all wives. The court directed the social welfare department to counsel a blind beggar against a third marriage, emphasizing that a man unable to support multiple wives is not entitled to remarry.

title: Adopted billionaires: Jobs, Bezos, Ellison; early struggles and unknown facts
content: Steve Jobs, Jeff Bezos, and Larry Ellison, all adopted, demonstrate how early life experiences can fuel success. Jobs' adoptive parents nurtured his creativity, while Bezos gained stability from his adoptive father. Ellison's challenging upbringing fostered self-reliance.

title: Over 100 SIMs, endless messages: Man stalked woman for more than 2 years on LinkedIn
content: A finance company director in Mumbai has filed a police complaint against Saurav Raidhani for alleged stalking and harassment. The accused, whom she initially connected with on LinkedIn, reportedly sent obscene messages and unwanted advances over two years. Despite being blocked, he allegedly used over 100 SIM cards to contact her, even tracking her movements abroad.

title: Zubeen Garg's body to be handed to India after Singapore post-mortem: Assam CM
content: The sudden demise of singer Zubeen Garg in a Singapore scuba diving accident has deeply saddened fans and the music industry. Assam's Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma is coordinating efforts to bring Garg's remains home, with a post-mortem scheduled in Singapore.

title: Swift faces backlash after Kelce supports suspended teammate
content: Travis Kelce's decision to wear a "Free 4" shirt in support of suspended teammate Rashee Rice has sparked controversy, drawing criticism from fans who deem it inappropriate given Rice's legal troubles stemming from a high-speed collision. The backlash extends to Taylor Swift, Kelce's fiancée, with some questioning her association with him.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Erika Kirk drags in Swift's name; Kelce stays silent
content: Following Charlie Kirk's shocking assassination, his widow, Erika Kirk, has ignited controversy by involving Taylor Swift in memorial plans. Erika's ambition to outshine a Taylor Swift concert at Kirk's memorial event on September 21st has sparked outrage among Swift's fans.

title: Serena Williams net worth 2025: tennis legacy, endorsements, ventures
content: Serena Williams, a tennis icon, boasts a net worth of $350 million in 2025. Her wealth comes from tennis wins, endorsements, and business ventures. She supports businesses run by women and people of color through Serena Ventures. Recently, she invested in Unrivaled, a women’s basketball league. Serena also launched a podcast with her sister, Venus.

title: Supreme Court approves AIFF constitution; 70-year age cap
content: The Supreme Court has finalised the All India Football Federation's (AIFF) constitution, mirroring the BCCI framework, barring ministers and bureaucrats from management and setting a 70-year age cap. The AIFF must adopt the revised constitution within four weeks, potentially by October 14 in Goa, to avoid FIFA suspension.

title: Sophie Cunningham’s shocking police standoff during WNBA match goes viral
content: Sophie Cunningham, sidelined with an MCL injury, found herself in a heated exchange with a police officer during a Fever-Dream game after rushing onto the court to check on a fallen teammate. The incident, caught on camera, quickly went viral on social media.

title: Slower tax refunds after ITR filing? IT dept detects false exemption claims of Rs 700cr
content: The Income-Tax Department is cracking down on fraudulent tax exemption claims, estimated at ₹700 crore, leading to potential refund delays, especially for claims over Rs 10 lakh. Discrepancies include fabricated medical expenses and false donations, primarily under the old tax framework.

title: Trump’s $1 million gold card visa: Who qualifies, what it offers – Here’s how to apply
content: Donald Trump has introduced the "Trump Gold Card," an immigration initiative offering wealthy individuals and corporations fast-tracked US residency. Priced at $1 million for individuals and $2 million per employee for corporations, it promises accelerated processing under EB-1 or EB-2 visa categories. The program aims to generate billions in revenue, potentially reducing taxes and debt.

title: 'Prove you’re pure': Gujarat woman forced to dip hand in boiling oil as 'fidelity test'
content: In a shocking incident in Gujarat's Mehsana district, a 28-year-old woman was allegedly forced to prove her fidelity by dipping her hand in boiling oil. The horrific act, allegedly orchestrated by her sister-in-law and aided by her brothers, left the victim with severe burns.

title: 'Project Firewall': H-1B visas to cost more, move to impact Indians
content: The US department of labour has launched "Project Firewall" to target H-1B visa misuse, aligning with President Trump's "America First" agenda. This initiative aims to protect American workers by scrutinising companies hiring foreign employees and ensuring fair wages. The secretary of labour will personally oversee investigations, with violators facing penalties like back wage repayment and program debarment, impacting industries heavily reliant on H-1B workers, especially Indian nationals.

title: J&K: Soldier killed in gunfight in Udhampur; hunt for terrorists resumes
content: A soldier critically wounded in a gunfight with terrorists in the Udhampur district of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday evening has died. The gunfight broke out during a joint search operation by the Army and J&K Police in the Seoj Dhar forest area. Security forces have cordoned off the area and are continuing search operations for the two to three terrorists believed to be hiding in the difficult terrain.

title: Did Suryakumar Yadav snub Pakistan again? India captain avoids naming arch-rivals
content: Suryakumar Yadav's continued refusal to acknowledge Pakistan fuels the anticipation for their Super 4 clash in the Asia Cup 2025. India secured a narrow victory against Oman, topping Group A, but the focus remains on the high-stakes encounter with their arch-rivals. Yadav's curt responses and previous controversies add extra spice to the upcoming showdown.

title: ‘Viktoriia’s Secret’: Man seeks reunion with son; Russian wife flees with child to Moscow
content: Saikat Basu is desperately seeking the return of his five-year-old son, Stavyo, after his estranged wife, Viktoriia, allegedly fled to Russia with the child in violation of Supreme Court orders. Basu claims Russian embassy personnel aided her departure from India. He emphasizes his focus is solely on reuniting with his son, highlighting Viktoriia's alleged negligence and cruelty towards Stavyo.

title: Terror case: J&K CIK raids across Valley; Srinagar, Pulwama, Anantnag among districts targeted
content: Counter Intelligence Kashmir conducted searches at multiple locations across seven districts in the Valley on Saturday, targeting terror-related activities. The coordinated operation spanned eight locations in Srinagar, Baramulla, Anantnag, Kupwara, Handwara, Pulwama, and Shopian, following warrants obtained from a competent court. This crackdown follows a deadly terror attack in April where 26 civilians were killed in Anantnag.

title: What Trump Gold card looks like? How it differs from Corporate Gold & Platinum
content: President Trump introduced the "Gold Card Visa," offering expedited US residency for wealthy individuals and corporations investing significant sums. The Gold Card requires a $1 million contribution, while the Platinum Card, pending approval, demands $5 million with tax benefits. Revenue will fund commerce promotion and debt reduction, potentially reshaping immigration policy by replacing existing visa programs.

title: Will Axar Patel miss Pakistan match after head blow? Latest update
content: During the Asia Cup clash against Oman, Axar Patel sustained a head injury while fielding, though he is reportedly "doing fine," according to India's fielding coach. Despite the setback, India secured a 21-run victory over Oman. Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma's contributions helped India post a total of 188/8. Arshdeep Singh also celebrated claiming his 100th T20I wicket.

title: Multiple Delhi schools receive bomb threats; students, staff evacuated
content: Several schools in Delhi, including DPS Dwarka and Krishna Model Public School, received bomb threat calls on Saturday, leading to immediate evacuations and extensive security sweeps. This incident follows a similar bomb threat at the Delhi High Court eight days prior, where an email alluded to a potential blast and alleged connections to Pakistani intelligence.

title: What is PMOA, which Pakistan cricket board is alleged to have breached? Explained
content: A heated dispute has erupted between the PCB and ICC over alleged protocol breaches during a recent Dubai match. The controversy centers on the PCB media manager's unauthorized mobile phone use in the PMOA, a violation of anti-corruption guidelines. While the PCB defends its position, ICC regulations strictly prohibit such usage, escalating tensions further as the Asia Cup clash approaches.

title: Big change for H-1Bs: Trump signs order imposing $100k annual visa application fee — What it means
content: President Trump has introduced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, aiming to reform the skilled worker program. This move seeks to discourage mass applications and address concerns about lower wages for foreign workers in entry-level positions. The changes could significantly impact startups and small businesses, potentially shifting focus back to American tech workers and protecting domestic employment.

title: Asia Cup: Oman skipper thanks SKY for pep talk; urges BCCI for NCA training support
content: After Oman’s spirited fight against India, captain Jatinder Singh thanked Suryakumar Yadav for his post-match pep talk, calling it invaluable for his young side. Jatinder urged the BCCI to grant Oman access to the National Cricket Academy, believing training in India would help bridge the gap with top-tier nations.

title: Trump protects US jobs: H-1B fee hiked; what changes for Indian workers
content: President Trump has raised the H-1B visa sponsorship fee to $100,000 to prioritise American jobs and curb outsourcing. Indian professionals, who form the majority of H-1B holders, may face reduced opportunities, especially in junior roles. The change pressures companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and TCS to reconsider hiring strategies, shifting focus to highly specialised, high-wage talent and domestic graduates.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift: From wedding rumours to surprise timeline
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, engaged since August, are reportedly planning an intimate wedding for early next year. While no venue is set, Rhode Island is a potential location. Swift is enjoying the creative process, with designers eager to create her gown, but the couple prioritizes a meaningful celebration with loved ones over a lavish spectacle.

title: Nasa shares Milky Way photos: Star clusters revealed; galaxy’s hidden core
content: NASA's advanced observatories have unveiled the Milky Way's hidden beauty, from its dense core with a supermassive black hole to glittering star clusters and spiral arms. Infrared cameras pierce through gas and dust, revealing millions of stars. These images help astronomers study star formation, galactic dynamics, and the future collision with Andromeda, enhancing our understanding of our galactic home.

title: Asia Cup: Sunil Gavaskar praises Suryakumar's decision on Oman
content: Sunil Gavaskar defended Suryakumar Yadav's choice to not bat against Oman, citing his unorthodox thinking and potential strategy to test Kuldeep Yadav's batting. Rohan Gavaskar questioned the move, suggesting Rinku Singh should have been given a chance instead. Despite the debate, India secured a 21-run victory, with experts highlighting Yadav's innovative captaincy and willingness to take risks.

title: ‘Stop selling drugs’: Trump orders strike on another narcotics boat; 3 killed
content: President Trump announced a military strike on a Venezuelan vessel allegedly involved in narcotrafficking, resulting in three deaths. The vessel was purportedly linked to a terrorist organization and accused of transporting narcotics towards the US This action follows previous strikes on similar vessels, escalating tensions with Venezuela, who condemned the U.S. actions as aggression and regime-change tactics.

title: Aamir Kaleem becomes oldest batter to score fifty vs India; breaks 79-year record
content: Oman opener Aamir Kaleem etched his name in cricket history by becoming the oldest batter to score a half-century against India, surpassing a 79-year-old record. His impressive 64-run innings against India marked a historic moment, also making him the oldest to hit a T20I fifty against a full member nation.

title: Trump's 'Gold Card' visa program: US rolls out residency scheme costing $1m
content: The US government has introduced a new visa program. It targets wealthy immigrants. The program offers American residency at high prices. A 'Trump Gold Card' costs $1 million. A 'Platinum Card' is priced at $5 million. Corporate investors can also participate. Donald Trump and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick unveiled the initiative. It aims to attract investment and create jobs.

title: IND vs OMA: Who is Aamir Kaleem? Oman’s 43-r-old opener battles cramps for fifty
content: Aamir Kaleem, a 43-year-old opener, defied expectations with a resilient 64 against India in the Asia Cup, giving Oman a glimmer of hope for an upset. His partnership with Hammad Mirza threatened India's dominance before Hardik Pandya's catch turned the tide, securing a 21-run victory for India despite Oman's spirited chase.

title: NDTV Yuva Conclave Live Updates: "Girls Are Making Huge Progress In Haryana," Says Nupur Sheoran
content: NDTV Yuva returns with its much-anticipated Mumbai edition today, bringing together powerful voices, thought-provoking conversations, and inspiring stories that reflect the spirit and ambition of young India.

title: Puja Khedkar Family's Bodyguard Arrested, Cops Suspect Parents Fleeing India
content: Former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar's family bodyguard, accused of abducting a truck driver after a road rage incident in Navi Mumbai, was arrested from Maharashtra's Dhule on Friday night.

title: India Says 'In Touch With Family' After Telangana Techie Was Shot Dead By US Cops
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday confirmed that India is in touch with the US authorities and with the family of a man from Telangana who was allegedly killed in Mohammed Nizamuddin.

title: Negative Media Coverage Is 'Illegal': Trump Amid Debate Over Kimmel Show
content: President Donald Trump on Friday bashed US media coverage that he claimed was unduly negative and therefore "illegal," stoking a debate over free speech following the suspension of comedian Jimmy Kimmel's TV show by ABC.

title: Al Qaeda May Leverage Global Wars Involving US Support: Counter-Terrorism Unit
content: The US National Counterterrorism Center said on Friday that recent calls by al Qaeda for attacks against the United States showed the group's enduring threat to the country.

title: "My Message For Asim Munir...": Imran Khan Accuses Army Chief Of Mental Torture
content: Incarcerated former prime minister Imran Khan on Friday said Pakistan Army Chief Gen Asim Munir is inflicting "mental torture" on him and his wife in jail to break them down and submit to him.

title: Soldier Killed In Encounter With Terrorists In J&K's Udhampur
content: A soldier was killed in action during a fierce gun battle with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district, official sources said.

title: "Abuse Of H-1B Programme National Security Threat": Trump As He Hikes Visa Fees
content: US President Donald Trump said abuse of the H-1B programme is a national security threat as he signed a proclamation restricting entry of certain non-immigrant workers and imposing a staggering annual USD 100,000 fee on the visas

title: 'Return To US Within 24 Hours, Don't Leave': Meta, Microsoft To H-1B Visa Holders
content: Major companies such as Meta and Microsoft went into a huddle on Saturday morning and urged all their H-1B visa holders to not leave the US for at least 14 days.

title: "Was Not Loyal": Gujarat Woman Forced To Dip Hands In Boiling Oil To Prove Fidelity
content: A video went viral showing a woman and three others forcing the victim to dip her hands in a pot of boiling oil.

title: After IT Sector, Industries Raise Alarm Over Poor Infrastructure In Bengaluru
content: As potholes in Bengaluru are now creating serious problems for industries, especially in the Peenya Industrial Area, the industrial community in the city has now raised red flags over deteriorating infrastructure.

title: Trump Slaps $100,000 Fee On H-1B Visas: What It Means For Indians
content: US President Donald Trump, in his latest efforts to crack down on immigration, signed a proclamation imposing a $100,000 (over Rs 88 lakh) fee on H-1B visa applicants.

title: Why Amitabh Kant Doesn't See $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee As Setback For India
content: US President Donald Trump's decision to raise the annual fee for H-1B visa to $100,000 will prove to be the country's loss and India's gain, former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant said on Saturday.

title: Why Trump Is Trying To Get Back Bagram Airfield In Afghanistan
content: US President Donald Trump has said he is in talks with the Taliban to bring Bagram Airfield in Afghanistan back under American control, calling the decision to abandon the site a mistake.

title: Amazon, TCS, Microsoft: These Firms May Be Worst Hit By Trump's H1-B Visa Fee Hike
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is the second-highest beneficiary with over 5,000 approved H-1B visas in 2025, after Amazon, according to the US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) data.

title: Meet Bihar's 'Mushroom Lady' Bina Devi, Who Is Now Empowering 70,000 Rural Women
content: In a quiet corner of Bihar's Munger district, a woman once struggled to feed her four children. Yet, it was in these circumstances that Bina Devi found an unusual way forward and she started cultivating mushrooms under the bed she slept

title: Mumbai To Get India's Largest Cruise Terminal: All You Need To Know
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate India's most expansive cruise terminal at the Mumbai Ballard Pier on Saturday.

title: "Reckless, Extreme": Trump's H-1B Fee Plan Draws Backlash From US Lawmakers
content: US lawmakers and community leaders voiced concern over US President Donald Trump's plan to impose a USD 100,000 fee on H-1B visa applications, calling the move "reckless" and "unfortunate" that will have a "huge negative" impact on the IT industry.

title: What Are Trump's Gold, Platinum, Corporate Gold Cards For H-1B Workers?
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday dramatically raised to $100,000 the annual fee for the H-1B visa for high-tech foreign workers - a move that is going to significantly impact Indians who are hired by tech firms and others.

title: "We Need Great Workers": Trump Slaps $100,000 Fee On H-1B Visas
content: President Donald Trump on Friday signed a proclamation that will require a new annual $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, among other changes to the program for highly skilled foreign workers that has come under scrutiny by the administration.
